'Minoxidil' is an antihypertensive vasodilator medication. It also slows or
stops hair loss and promotes hair regrowth. Now off-patent, it is available over-the-
counter for the treatment of androgenic alopecia. Minoxidil must be used
indefinitely for continued support of existing hair follicles and the
maintenance of any experienced hair regrowth. It is marketed under many trade
names, including 'Avacor Physician's Formulation', 'Loniten' (oral), 'Mintop',
'Amexidil', 'Rogaine', 'Spectral.DNC', and 'Vanarex'. Kopexil is a derivative of
minoxidil missing the piperidine substituent.
